callforspeaker.content:
DevFest Calgary is bringing over 100 developers together **November 3** together in Calgary in the beautiful Riddel Library at MRU. Our focus is the content. **We’re looking for speakers like you**, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.
Submit a proposal

Why is it cool to speak at the DevFest?
DevFest Calgary is not an ordinary tech conference, besides selecting only the best speakers, we help them to succeed in delivering an exceptional quality talk on the stage. Here are few perks that all our speakers get:
**Exposure**. By being a speaker, you are proving your level of expertise to a potential business partners or employers. Your talk will be promoted in our online resources and recording published in YouTube channel.
**Unique networking**. Being a speaker means you’ll have the unique chance to network with other speakers - the best experts in the industry.
**Coaching**. We're in the same boat, after being selected as a speaker our program committee will help you to deliver the best talk possible. We provide information about the audience, presentation templates, feedback on the slides, all to help you to prepare.
What are we looking for? We're looking for **experience-based talks**, the information that can not be found in the documentation or easily googled. We're looking for your stories, your struggles, research results and experiences with the frontier tools or technologies. Check the [list of topics](https://codelabs.developers.google.com/devfest18) we're interested in (it is not full and updated all the time). You can submit as many talks as you want. This year we accept submissions in two formats:
- 45 minutes sessions
- 10 Minute Lightning Talks
- 1-2 hour workshops

Talks that will not pass initial review:
- Talks about a specific tool/library/project explaining how it works or how to use it.
- Talks whose focus is pitching a company or project. It’s cool that you mention your company during the presentation, but it shouldn’t be the focus of the talk.
- Proposals that are not in English.
- Recruitment talks to attract talent.

We strongly recommend you check out [speaking.io](http://speaking.io) website from Zach Holman. It includes good tips and guidelines for speakers.
Timeline ** Call for Papers submission deadline is October 15, 2018**. Submission results will be announced by October 20. Any questions? Email organizers at speakers@gdgyyc.com
Submit a proposal
callforspeaker.title: We're looking for speakers

dfca18-announced.brief: It is official. DevFestYYC 2019 will take place in Calgary, November 22-23.
dfca18-announced.content:
It is official. DevFestYYC 2019 will take place in **Calgary, on November 22-23**. Described as "Where Alberta's future is launching!", DevFestYYC 2019 is bringing world-class Google Cloud and Cloud Native experts to Calgary. Building on the success of DevFestYYC 2018, we've grown from a small 100-people event to the biggest Google technology celebration in Western Canada. This year, we expect over 330+ developers, data scientists, cloud architects, technologists and entrepreneurs from around the world to join us to learn about about cutting edge Android, Web and Google Cloud technologies. We combine this incredible learning opportunity with a phenomenal atmosphere and the gorgeous Calgary Central Libray, and DevFestYYC is sure to be unforgettable!

What to expect? **4 parallel Tracks: Learn about Cloud Infrastructure, Data & Analytics, Code and Development and Developer programs.** You will hear and learn from speakers and presenters from leading companies like Google, SoftServe, Flexera, ATB and AIRIA.

We are stoked to see yo all there!
Register

DevFestYYC 2019 Team.
dfca18-announced.title: Announcing DevFestYYC 2019

185.description: Microservices is coming with a certain workload and constraints. Let's try to see how Google Cloud Platform and App Engine can help the overall microservices implementation.
185.title: Microservices in Google App Engine

190.description:
Storing account information is a common challenge many app developers face, and is often tackled in tailored solutions. Isn't there some strategy to store account credentials in a centralized place?

What about considerations for multiple accounts? Security concerns? And when should or could I synchronize data?

Android offers a powerful—and underrated—account manager. Let's explore the possibilities together and lay out an architecture for engineering an Android app based on accounts.
190.title: I’ve been doing some syncing…

195.description: Upcoming Android N release will bring some interesting changes to both Android run-time and toolchain. Let's talk about JIT, AOT, hybrid JIT/AOT, Jack, Jill and other acronyms and codenames ;-) In this presentation we'll see how many awesome tricks are needed to make our apps start fast and run smoothly on modern Android devices. Hopefully we'll also answer the most important question -- what's next for Android after Java.
195.title: Android tool-chain and run-time improvements in N

200.description:
One of my favourite things about the web are ASCII smileys. They're sweet, fun and simply make the web a better place. How could anyone not like them ¯(ツ)/¯?

This talk is an overdose of smileys, because they're the perfect excuse to get started with Polymer. Polymer is a library built on top of the Web Components standards that helps developers create reusable components for the modern web. And since I know that everybody has been wondering how one could take over the world by creating a suite of Polymer animated emoticon components, we're going to do exactly that.
200.title: On Polymer and smileys... or Polysmileys

205.description: Afterparty is a great time to have some fun and meet new people

https://calgaryherald.com/news/local-news/calgary-students-win-gold-at-china-robotics-challenge

And I am a Founder and Lead Developer at Immediate Rent.

When not designing her heart out, Charlie is a local tai chi and taekwondo instructor.

Her passion for designing and developing software that improves end-users’ lives led her to champion and educate on the use of G-Suite for people to transform the way they work.

Greg_Bennett.name: Greg Bennett
Greg_Bennett.bio:
Greg transforms complex enterprises and builds world-class developer communities. He founded AIRIA.CLOUD and GDGYYC and leads cloud migration, ML and IoT projects in partnership with Google Cloud. He’s a sought after international speaker and facilitator. 

 You can catch him at gregbennett.io or skateboarding to his next meeting.
Greg_Bennett.title: Founder @ GDGYYC, President @ AIRIA Cloud

Gunjan_Kaur.name: Gunjan Kaur
Gunjan_Kaur.bio: Gunjan received her masters degree in Economics and Finance from the University of Alberta. After stints in social market research and FX modelling, she ventured into risk management practice at ATB. Curious about applying her machine learning skills in industry, she later joined the Artificial Intelligence guild at ATB. She led the Real Time Triggers University of Alberta-ATB AI Lab focused on utilizing cutting edge Internet of Things (IOT) methodologies to effectively and efficiently analyze ATB data streams in real time. She also participated in specialized programs at Google and Fintech research at the University of Oxford. In her most recent role, she is leading experimentation analytics for a strategic initiative aimed at increasing customer engagement. She is passionate about data wizardry and problem solving expertise to big data challenges in the financial realm, helping transform ATB to make banking work for Albertans.
Gunjan_Kaur.title: Director of Analytics, ATB Financial

Hans_Hegge.name: Hans Hegge
Hans_Hegge.bio: In the last 12 months, both Sam Barbeau and Hans Hegge have spoken about migration in 12 cities across the US as well as in London and Paris. We are asked to talk on migrations by large consulting partners, end customers, as well by the cloud providers.  Our backgrounds in technology expand from startups in mobile to corporating training of enterprise teams. We like to keep our session interactive and open for dialog.
Hans_Hegge.title: Flexera Channel Account Manager

Josh_Fafard.bio:

Current startups include Akinê Inc. and Offcourse Golf.  Although GCP is a fairly new to me, I'm working to use all the right building blocks to architect scalable solutions.
Josh_Fafard.title: Akinê Inc.

Katie_Murray.bio: In a few short years at ATB, Katie Murray has already worked in several different roles in the company; from “real” banking, to assisting with the company’s transition to Google, and now working in AI and process automation. She leads a squad of developers, automation analysts, and data scientists and collaborates with business stakeholders and executives alike to deliver happiness daily. In her free time, Katie runs a small wedding planning business, loves DIY home improvement projects, and hangs out with her dog Louis Litt.

Katie_Murray.title: Senior Manager, Intelligent Process Automation (ATB Financial)

He also has an interest for Google Cloud platform and one of his areas of interest is the Google Maps. He is the convener of the Local Guide Community in Calgary.

AltaML builds transformational software applications for business, powered by machine learning. AltaML partners with organizations using a co-development model where we can provide technical and strategic expertise on how to leverage their data with AI/ML technologies with a specific focus on healthcare.
Lucas_Scheer.shortBio: Lucas is the Managing Director at AltaML in Calgary

Scott_Stoll.name: Scott Stoll
Scott_Stoll.bio:
Scott is an American app developer, author, speaker, trainer and Flutter evangelist. He has been involved with Flutter since the 9th commit, v0.0.14, and possesses a Nanodegree from Google / Udacity in Android Development.

Today, Scott is the primary organizer of GDG Cleveland and the NE Ohio Flutter Developers Meetup,  co-founder of the Flutter Study Group Slack (FSG) and Editor for Flutter Community on Medium. He is also the creator of #HumpDayQandA, a weekly, remote video conference held every Wednesday where people can come for free, live help with Flutter.

He's available for talks, workshops and consulting both nationally and internationally.
Scott_Stoll.title: Flutter Community

Shaun_Mitchell.name: Shaun Mitchell
Shaun_Mitchell.bio:
Shaun wants to live in a place where all work can be done at the beach and in the sun, he also wants dark chocolate to be considered a major food group.

As an IT professional with over 19 years experience, he has a passion for all things cloud technology related. He started his career has a software engineer building e-commerce websites for some large brands. Since those days he has managed to find is way through the IT space; building software for integrating desperate systems, developing software for managing national last mile telecommunications networks to data center operations and network administration. For a short time, Shaun tried his had at being a database administrator and found he lacked the necessary passion so he moved into the data warehousing ETL space (back to the code). After a few years of building data pipelines he then moved into IT Operations and Cloud Strategy. Shaun as worked migrating enterprises to the Microsoft productivity suite (Office 365) and compute workloads to Azure as well as Google Cloud Platform.

Shaun is a certified Professional Scrum Master, certified Google Cloud Architect and a certified PADI Advanced Scuba Diver, of course these have nothing to do with each other. He spent 4 years living in Bermuda, the question is would he ever go back? ..... (see above).
Shaun_Mitchell.shortBio: Google Cloud Architect working with Enterprises to transform their cloud experience
Shaun_Mitchell.title: Google Cloud Architect working with Enterprises to transform their cloud experience

Suni_Mathews.name: Suni Mathews
Suni_Mathews.bio: I am data wrangler with ATB’s Innovation team, enabling AI and ML for future business models, products and experiences in ATB.  My career in data analytics has seen me explore the various areas of data engineering to gain a wholesome appreciation for  data driven decision making.  My career of many years cover analysis, integration, business intelligence and architecture of data systems.  Currently, I’m keenly following the data sciences and cloud engineering trends for innovative solutions.
Suni_Mathews.title: Data Engineer

Suryatapa_Roy.shortBio: Data Scientist@CHATA.AI. Research in Virtual Reality and Machine Learning@UofC

Tim_Chan.name: Tim Chan
Tim_Chan.bio:
Tim Chan has over 15 years of experience in the energy industry with a focus on integrated (upstream to downstream) energy, power generation, commodities trading and enterprise risk management.

He currently leads internal audit projects at Suncor Energy Inc., while previously leading teams of accountants in support of Suncor's supply and trading activities. He has also instructed at the University of Calgary, through the Haskayne School of Business, in the area of Financial Accounting.

In 2018, Tim helped to found Untapped Energy, a data science startup for data practitioners in the energy industry, in the Calgary area, organizing a weekend long datathon aim at solving problems for this industry.
Tim_Chan.title: Co-founder of Untapped Energy

He is also the Chairman and a co-Founder of A100 (www.thea100.org), an organization which aims to inspire and support generations of Alberta tech entrepreneurs. With a computer science degree and 30+ year career in software development & commercialization, Stephen has written over a million lines of code and sold more than $500M in software. My skillset includes data trend analysis/forecasting, financial modeling/analysis/valuations, industry/company research, database creation/maintenance/optimization, analyzing financing proposals and key commercial agreements and financial due diligence. I have a Bachelor of Business Administration degree with a concentration in Finance from the Williams School of Business at Bishop's University, Quebec.
